result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L Nielsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • MA-Fraud/Benefit Application (Items), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 49.49(1)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Eric L Nielsen in court with attorney John H. Bradley.  Thomas L. Storm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 18 months,  Extended Supervision: 18 months)  Stayed for 18 months Probation - may be transferred to Dane County. 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00  - apply bail
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.    Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- 160 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing June 29, 2015 by 6:00 p.m..  Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Last 10 days jail  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. Sentence may be transferred to Dane County. No Electronic Monitoring.

Defendant Eric L Nielsen in court with attorney John H. Bradley.   Thomas L. Storm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 2, 3 and 4 dismised and read-in. State and Defense request a PSI. Court orders a PreSentence Investigation be compiled and filed within 45 days. Report to be filed by  06/05/2015.  Court will give a sentencing date in 60 days. Bail remains as fixed. Atty. Storm requests the PreSentence be sent to him and Defense electronically. Court grants request.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
